TopicTitle: [0.21] Kerbal LiveFeed: Passive Multiplayer Plugin/Client/Server v0.7.1

Articles.Content:
I've gotten together with noble, our code is now integrated and we are more then happy to continue dev, atleast for the time being. I have a fork up on github, not integrated with nobles yet, but we will more than likely post all updates to github under some account.

We need to do a bit of organization to get everything straight, but, with permission, we should be able to publish some updates fairly quickly. We were both messing around with the code, but waiting for permission, now that we have it, we need permission to either edit the OP on the thread (don't know if that's possible) or release on a separate thread. I guess noble tried posting a new thread, but it was shot down by a mod.

So far the features/improvements discussed.

-(done) fix /sharecraft

-(done) toggles for chat/screenshot view

-(almost) GUI client /server (GUI client lacks chat capability *only GUI, KSP chat unaffected*).

-(working on) screen shot performance.

-(future) video / continuous low fps screenshot mode

any additional feature suggestions are welcomed, but please within reason. ("add real multiplayer") ya that might take a minute or two

Edit: What we've both posted already are compatible with the existing KLF servers. The changes I've made deal with the clientside/plugin only to fix sharecraft and add toggles, and the client/server GUI's (noble) are independent and compatible. These will both be merged into one version and available very soon. (along with the source).

In the meantime, if you really want to latest of the latest, my update (dll) is compatable with nobles (client/server gui) and are interchangeable, but again, these will be merged very soon.

Nice to hear. Also, I appreciate that you're keeping with git.

I'd like to recommend a distribution model -- while SpacePort or any other mirror are perfectly viable, github's new terms permits small releases and they provide a handy feature for it: See https://github.com/blog/1547-release-your-software

It's really convenient and fast for releasing a dev branch for testing.

I got the mod to work, but all the words are broken. Some of the letters are invisible.

Edited October 28, 2013 by SergeantBlueforce

I got the mod to work, but all the words are broken. Some of the letters are invisible.

Could you provide the exact steps of your install? I get this glitch too if I start KSP before KLF, but not after. I also get this from time to time when alt-tabbing out.

I would like to report a bug for the new KLF 0.7.2, the KLFclient eats all the CPU processing capacity of one core. Why is it doing this? Can I revert to KLF 0.7.1 and use that for .22?

Help i installed the plugin correctly, i opened up ksp and the client but when i try to connect to a server it says server ip: 69.64.48.69:2075

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

at Client.get_isConnected()

at Client.connectToServer(ClientSettings settings)

at ConsoleClient.connectionLoop(ClientSettings settings)

at ConsoleClient.connect(ClientSettings settings)
The latest version seems to have some sort of resource leak, takes 50% of my dual core.

Does this work on Linux? When I try to run it with the sudo mono KLFClient.exe command, I get this error:

Unhandled Exception: System.EntryPointNotFoundException: FindWindow

at (wrapper managed-to-native) ClientMain:FindWindow (string,string)

at ClientMain.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.EntryPointNotFoundException: FindWindow

at (wrapper managed-to-native) ClientMain:FindWindow (string,string)

at ClientMain.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

xxxxx@xxxxx-G50V:~/.steam/steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal Space Program$

Clicking the exe doesn't do anything at all. The program appears in the taskbar and then disappears after a while as it can't start.

It looks like the 0.7.2 server is not able to run in command line mode. The previous version doesn't have this probleme.

Could you please make sure to keep the Linux and command line compatibility, because that is how a lot (and my) servers run.

Im glad im not the only one

Really want to go on, KLF is the reason why i do missions (and amuse people and look dumb). Singleplayer seems so damn barren, like being stuck in dry, dry flat desert.

I'll try to set up a server? Can SOMEBODY please set up a server? i BEG of you all!

Guys! Big News! lf.general-physics.de is up again!

COME ON IN!

At first i thought the server was self-aware and was rebelling from us by refusing our connections xD

This is a message to that person who tried to enter "gboxg.co.uk" with HTTP-Port 2074 into my status-page. Thank you for breaking the script. I tried to exactly enter the data in the database again but this time I got the response: "Port open but no KLF server found." which is in this case true. So, somehow that person managed to enter data which is not allowed.

I know I'm a little late but I rarely come on the forums. Sorry about that! Didn't think it'd crash the script.
Would it be possible to get the console chat feature back? I hate having to stay silent while my game loads, or not being able to chat without starting the game - whatever the reason.
Is there any chance of an update to work with .23, either by SodiumEyes or anyone else? (The GUI does not appear ingame.)
